intro: Scelochilus peruvianus, commonly known as the Peruvian scelochilus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. It is often found in mountainous areas of Peru and neighboring countries. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
